edu.rit.aes

Class AESBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.crst.Computation
      • edu.rit.crst.Function
        • edu.rit.aes.AESBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AES128, AES192, AES256

    public abstract class AESBase
extends Function
    Class AESBase is the abstract base class for the AES block cipher. The AES cryptographic function's input A is the plaintext (128 bits); input B is the key (128, 192, or 256 bits); output C is the ciphertext (128 bits).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AESBase()
      Construct a new AES cryptographic function.

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate(BigInt A,
            BigInt B,
            BigInt[] C)
        Evaluate this cryptographic function. The function is evaluated on inputs A and B, and the output of each round is stored in the C array.

        Note: The evaluate() method is performed on the CPU in a single thread. It is intended as a cross-check for the GPU kernel.

        Specified by:
        evaluate in class Function
        Parameters:
        A - Input A.
        B - Input B.
        C - Array of outputs C, indexed by round.
